'''Rod Jellema''' ([[1927]] - [[2018]]) was an American poet, teacher, and translator. 
In 1956 Jellema began teaching introductory literature and composition courses at the University of Maryland, where he now is Professor Emeritus of English.<ref>David Garret Izzo, ''[[W.H. Auden: A Legacy]]'', "Contributors", p. xviii</ref><ref>[http://www.calvin.edu/publications/spark/2009/summer/jellema.htm Alumni Profile • Rod Jellema ’51] at [http://www.calvin.edu/ Calvin.edu] (accessed 9 November 2010)</ref>

During spring 1966, Jellema corresponded with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] concerning the controversy surrounding [[W.H. Auden]]'s intended book on Tolkien (see letter [[Letter to Rod Jellema]]).<ref>Rod Jellema, "Auden on Tolkien: The Book that Isn't, and the House that Brought it Down", in ''[[W.H. Auden: A Legacy]]'', pp. 39-45</ref>
